Catalan

[edit]

Etymology

[edit]

Borrowed from Latin complicāre.

Pronunciation

[edit]
  • IPA(key): (Central) [kum.pliˈka]
  • IPA(key): (Balearic) [kom.pliˈka]
  • IPA(key): (Valencia) [kom.pliˈkaɾ]

Verb

[edit]

complicar (first-person singular present complico, first-person singular preterite compliquí, past participle complicat)

  1. to complicate

Conjugation

[edit]
    Conjugation of complicar (first conjugation, c-qu alternation)
infinitive complicar
gerund complicant
past participle masculine feminine
singular complicat complicada
plural complicats complicades
person singular plural
first second third first second third
indicative jo tu ell/ella
vostè 		nosaltres
nós 		vosaltres
vós 		ells/elles
vostès
present complico compliques complica compliquem compliqueu compliquen
imperfect complicava complicaves complicava complicàvem complicàveu complicaven
future complicaré complicaràs complicarà complicarem complicareu complicaran
preterite compliquí complicares complicà complicàrem complicàreu complicaren
conditional complicaria complicaries complicaria complicaríem complicaríeu complicarien
subjunctive jo tu ell/ella
vostè 		nosaltres
nós 		vosaltres
vós 		ells/elles
vostès
present compliqui compliquis compliqui compliquem compliqueu compliquin
imperfect compliqués compliquessis compliqués compliquéssim compliquéssiu compliquessin
imperative — tu vostè nosaltres vosaltres
vós 		vostès
affirmative — complica compliqui compliquem compliqueu compliquin
negative (no) — no compliquis no compliqui no compliquem no compliqueu no compliquin

Related terms

[edit]
  • complicació
  • complicat

Further reading

[edit]
  • “complicar”, in Diccionari de la llengua catalana [Dictionary of the Catalan Language] (in Catalan), second edition, Institute of Catalan Studies [Catalan: Institut d'Estudis Catalans], April 2007

Franco-Provençal

[edit]

Etymology

[edit]

Borrowed from French compliquer.

Verb

[edit]

complicar (ORB, broad)

  1. to complicate

Conjugation

[edit]

5=avêr

[edit]
  • compliquer in DicoFranPro: Dictionnaire Français/Francoprovençal – on dicofranpro.llm.umontreal.ca

Galician

[edit]

Etymology

[edit]

Learned borrowing from Latin complicāre.

Verb

[edit]

complicar (first-person singular present complico, first-person singular preterite compliquei, past participle complicado)

  1. to complicate

Conjugation

[edit]

Further reading

[edit]
  • “complicar”, in Dicionario da Real Academia Galega (in Galician), A Coruña: Royal Galician Academy, 2012–2025
  • “complicar”, in Dicionário Estraviz de galego (in Galician), 2014–2025

Portuguese

[edit]

Etymology

[edit]

Borrowed from Latin complicāre. Compare the inherited conchegar and aconchegar.

Pronunciation

[edit]
 
  • (Brazil) IPA(key): /kõ.pliˈka(ʁ)/ [kõ.pliˈka(h)]
  • (Brazil) IPA(key): /kõ.pliˈka(ʁ)/ [kõ.pliˈka(h)]
    • (São Paulo) IPA(key): /kõ.pliˈka(ɾ)/
    • (Rio de Janeiro) IPA(key): /kõ.pliˈka(ʁ)/ [kõ.pliˈka(χ)]
    • (Southern Brazil) IPA(key): /kõ.pliˈka(ɻ)/
 
  • (Portugal) IPA(key): /kõ.pliˈkaɾ/
  • (Portugal) IPA(key): /kõ.pliˈkaɾ/
    • (Southern Portugal) IPA(key): /kõ.pliˈka.ɾi/

  • Hyphenation: com‧pli‧car

Verb

[edit]

complicar (first-person singular present complico, first-person singular preterite compliquei, past participle complicado)

  1. (transitive) to complicate (to combine or associate so as to make intricate or difficult)
  2. (intransitive) to become complicated
  3. (intransitive, of a situation, illness or problem) to become serious or grave

Conjugation

[edit]
    Conjugation of complicar (c-qu alternation) (See Appendix:Portuguese verbs)
Singular Plural
First-person
(eu) 		Second-person
(tu) 		Third-person
(ele / ela / você) 		First-person
(nós) 		Second-person
(vós) 		Third-person
(eles / elas / vocês)
Infinitive
Impersonal complicar
Personal complicar complicares complicar complicarmos complicardes complicarem
Gerund
complicando
Past participle
Masculine complicado complicados
Feminine complicada complicadas
Indicative
Present complico complicas complica complicamos complicais complicam
Imperfect complicava complicavas complicava complicávamos complicáveis complicavam
Preterite compliquei complicaste complicou complicamos1, complicámos2 complicastes complicaram
Pluperfect complicara complicaras complicara complicáramos complicáreis complicaram
Future complicarei complicarás complicará complicaremos complicareis complicarão
Conditional complicaria complicarias complicaria complicaríamos complicaríeis complicariam
Subjunctive
Present complique compliques complique compliquemos compliqueis compliquem
Imperfect complicasse complicasses complicasse complicássemos complicásseis complicassem
Future complicar complicares complicar complicarmos complicardes complicarem
Imperative
Affirmative complica complique compliquemos complicai compliquem
Negative (não) não compliques não complique não compliquemos não compliqueis não compliquem

1Brazilian Portuguese.
2European Portuguese.

Related terms

[edit]
  • complexo
  • complicação

Spanish

[edit]

Etymology

[edit]

Borrowed from Latin complicāre.

Pronunciation

[edit]
  • IPA(key): /kompliˈkaɾ/ [kõm.pliˈkaɾ]
  • Rhymes: -aɾ
  • Syllabification: com‧pli‧car

Verb

[edit]

complicar (first-person singular present complico, first-person singular preterite compliqué, past participle complicado)

  1. to complicate
  2. (reflexive) to get complicated, to get messy
  3. (reflexive) to make it harder or more difficult for oneself

Conjugation

[edit]
    Conjugation of complicar (c-qu alternation) (See Appendix:Spanish verbs)
infinitive complicar
gerund complicando
past participle masculine feminine
singular complicado complicada
plural complicados complicadas
singular plural
1st person 2nd person 3rd person 1st person 2nd person 3rd person
indicative yo tú
vos 		él/ella/ello
usted 		nosotros
nosotras 		vosotros
vosotras 		ellos/ellas
ustedes

conditional complicaría complicarías complicaría complicaríamos complicaríais complicarían

negative no compliques no complique no compliquemos no compliquéis no compliquen

1Mostly obsolete, now mainly used in legal language.
2Argentine and Uruguayan voseo prefers the tú form for the present subjunctive.

    Selected combined forms of complicar (c-qu alternation)

These forms are generated automatically and may not actually be used. Pronoun usage varies by region.

Related terms

[edit]

  • complicado
